resource.title: FlippinRad Motion Morph LoRA
resource.description: A custom LoRA designed for Wan2.1 that injects dynamic, stylized movement into animations with AnimateDiff-inspired flow and Steerable Motion precision
resource.creator: Flipping Sigmas

requirements: High VRAM setup (A6000/5090 recommended, 4090 with optimizations)
recommended_settings: High noise LoRA strength: adjustable (start with default, can bump up for fp8 models)
Low noise LoRA strength: 0.7 or lower to prevent random objects
Color match strength: 0.5 to prevent dark videos
Use smaller VAE with fp8 scaled models
tips: Wan2.1 performs 99.9% as well as 2.2 with dual sampler passes
Add 'green olive tone color' to negative prompt to avoid color shifts
Turn off 'add noise to sampling' on low noise pass to preserve colors but reduce motion
Use block swapping if you have enough system RAM for higher VRAM efficiency
Connect prompts to text encode cache to prevent second pass issues
usage.workflow_notes: Workflow includes Google API node for automatic prompting (can be bypassed), color matching, and frame interpolation to reduce pauses between segments

technical_details: Trained using a mix of AnimateDiff videos without captions initially
Uses dual-pass sampling (high noise + low noise) for better quality
Incorporates frame interpolation and color matching post-processing
V2 trained as proper i2v LoRA instead of T2V style
V8 version focuses on better style adherence and realistic motion

issues_and_solutions.issue: Second pass adds random objects (planes, buildings, butterflies)
issues_and_solutions.solution: Lower LoRA strength to 0.7, ensure prompts are connected to text encode cache, check prompt content

issues_and_solutions.issue: Videos turn out dark or washed out
issues_and_solutions.solution: Adjust color match strength to 0.5 or lower, disable 'add additional noise' in low noise sampler
Add 'green olive tone color' to negative prompt, adjust color match reference image
Use 1024x576 resolution (dimensions divisible by 32), check LoRA selections
Use GGUF models, smaller VAE, increase block swap, try Wan2.1 instead of 2.2

issues_and_solutions.issue: Aggressive transition to last frame with Wan2.2
issues_and_solutions.solution: Enable t2v lighting LoRA, adjust lighting LoRA strengths in both passes

summary: FlippinRad Motion Morph is a powerful LoRA for Wan2.1/2.2 that creates dynamic, stylized animations inspired by AnimateDiff. The community has extensively tested and optimized workflows, sharing solutions for common issues like color shifts, memory problems, and unwanted artifacts while developing multiple versions with improved quality and style adherence.
